etymology.description: 凉(cool; cooling) + 茶(tea; beverage) = cooling herbal tea.
etymology.interpretation: A cooling medicinal infusion used to dispel internal heat, especially in southern Chinese (Cantonese) tradition. Commonly brewed from herbs rather than Camellia sinensis leaves.
etymology.simplification: 涼 → 凉 by replacing the water radical 氵 with the ice radical 冫 and reducing strokes; 茶 unchanged. A standard simplification that preserves the 'cool' sense while streamlining writing.

parts.english: tea; tea plant; tea leaves; beverage

examples.chinese: 我们常在夏天喝凉茶(我們常在夏天喝涼茶)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen cháng zài xiàtiān hē liángchá.
examples.english: We often drink herbal tea in summer.

examples.chinese: 广州的凉茶铺很多(廣州的涼茶鋪很多)。
examples.pinyin: Guǎngzhōu de liángchá pù hěn duō.
examples.english: There are many herbal tea shops in Guangzhou.

examples.chinese: 喝太多会苦(喝太多會苦)，但能清热降火(但能清熱降火)。
examples.pinyin: Hē tài duō huì kǔ, dàn néng qīngrè jiànghuǒ.
examples.english: Drinking too much is bitter, but it can clear heat and reduce internal fire.
